sentence.Network_en: By epiphany he means'sudden spiritual manifestation ".
sentence.Network_cn: 他的“显现”指的是“神灵的突现 ”.

sentence.Network_en: By epiphany he means'the most delicate and evanescent of such memorable focusing moments.'

sentence.Network_en: They an intellectual epiphany and think they've experienced catharsis.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们知性富有洞察力,认为自己经历了这样的过程.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 这个顿悟（epiphany）与父亲的名义是严格相关的；关于母亲的欲望的某种无法命名的东西是由阳具的缺失象征化的，结果导致了象 …
主显节游行：周三在西班牙塞维利亚，人们装扮成阿拉伯族贝都因人的样子，参加主显节(Epiphany)游行。
2月6日显现节(Epiphany) 复活节前一个周五受难节(Good Friday)  4月复活节(Easter Monday) 5月1日的前一天晚上,是瑞典人庆祝冬去.
面容是主显（epiphany），面容是启示（revelation），面容是表达（expression）-- 耶稣才是意义的源头，而非由我们所赋予的意义 …

list.abs: They get an intellectual epiphany and think they ' ve catharsis ., 他们知性富有洞察力 , 认为自己经历了这样的过程.
but i guess it was an epiphany for him ., 我猜那对他来说是一种启示.
epiphanies often strike in the most unusual places--in bed , taking a shower or simply taking a power walk with the dog .灵感往往出现在最不平常的地方——在床上、淋浴的时候或者只是被狗牵着快步走的时候。
there will be sparkling epiphanies experienced on the landscape of your minds as you blossom exponentially .当你们以指数方式兴旺开花的时候，在你们的思维的景象中将会经验闪光的顿悟。

entry.tran: （基督教1月6日为纪念贤士朝拜基督的）主显节，显现节
entry.def: Epiphany is a Christian festival on the 6th of January which celebrates the arrival of the wise men who came to see Jesus Christ soon after he was born.
An epiphany is a moment of sudden insight or understanding.

example.ex: ...Isaac Newton's epiphany about gravity and a falling apple.
example.tran: 艾萨克·牛顿关于地心引力和苹果落地的顿悟
